alert.note: Alert for Breathitt; Estill; Lee; Morgan; Owsley; Powell; Wolfe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 11:56AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Powell, southwestern Morgan, northwestern Owsley, east central Estill, northwestern Breathitt, Lee and Wolfe Counties through 1230 PM EDT... At 1155 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Zoe, or near Beattyville, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Booth, Rogers and Primrose around 1200 PM EDT. Grannie, Vada, Pine Ridge, Williba, Jenson and Monica around 1205 PM EDT. Mary, High Falls, Flat, Widecreek and Fillmore around 1210 PM EDT. Campton, Vortex, Calaboose and War Creek around 1215 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Baptist, Hollonville, Lane, Stillwater, Bethany, Pence, Gosneyville, Lawson, Malaga, Landsaw, Trent, Wilhurst, Vancleve, Toliver, Simpson, Lexie, Upper Gilmore, Gilmore, Paxton, Rosefork, Lower Gilmore, Lee City, Shockey and Helechawa. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Breathitt; Estill; Lee; Morgan; Owsley; Powell; Wolfe
